00044 typedef struct s_seg_priv t_seg_priv;
00045 struct s_seg_priv
00046 {
00047         STRUCT_HEADER;
00048 };
00049 /*
00050     the segment stuct contains info about one segment.
00051     these are - in case of more segments - linked together
00052     to a doiuble linked list.
00053 */
00054 typedef struct s_segment t_segment;
00055 struct s_segment
00056 {
00057         STRUCT_HEADER_LIST(t_segment);
00058     char *name;                 // like ".text" or "FLASH"
00059     unsigned int start;         // start address
00060     unsigned int end;           // end address
00061     unsigned int length;        // length of data
00062     unsigned char *data;        // the data block
00063     t_seg_priv *priv;                 // format parser private data
00064 };
00065 
00066 t_segment *segment_find_by_end ( t_segment * s, unsigned int addr );
00067 t_segment *segment_find_by_start ( t_segment * s, unsigned int addr );

00070 t_segment *segment_create ( void );
00071 t_segment *segment_find_by_num ( t_segment * s, int num );
00072 t_segment *segment_get_last ( t_segment * s );
00073 t_segment *segment_duplicate ( t_segment * s );

00075 int segment_dump ( t_segment * s );
00076 int segment_count ( t_segment * s );
